intro: Stenolobus triphyllus, commonly known as the three-leafed milkweed, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa. It belongs to the Apocynaceae family and is characterized by its opposite, trifoliate leaves. The plant produces showy, clustered flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often growing in rocky or sandy soils. The plant is known for its milky sap, which is a common feature among members of its family.
